授業目的: 1. to give you the skills and practice to comfortably write a scientific research paper or report
到達目標:
-Develop a sense of scientific writing skills with respect to style and language
-Learn how to construct scientific reports of appropriate format and focus
-Learn how to identify scientific problems that need investigation
-Learn how to think and solve problems in a logical fashion
授業方法: The theories, flowchart, pathway, writing, and presentation will be taught via slides of power points. Some of the questions will be given to students in order to evaluate their understanding of this lecture.

第1回:
-Course Introduction
-Introduction to environmental and resource issues facing society
第2回: How interdisciplinary environmental and sustainability issues really are selecting a topic and creating a title for your term paper
第3回: Small group discussion on chosen topics (as explained in the second week)
第4回: Primary, secondary, gray literature, manuscript for submission, submission cover letter
第5回: Plagiarism, referencing citations, other academic documents
第6回: Referencing Tables, Figures, Creating an outline for your paper.
第7回: Developing an annotated bibliography, Abstract writing, Word processing skills for scientists
第8回: How to peer review properly and pass out peer reviews
第9回: Individual office appointment for paper discussion completed with IMRD
第10回: Individual office appointment for paper discussion completed with IMRD
第11回: Papers: the good, the bad, the ugly of IMRD
トピック.授業外学習2: Master students have to prepare by themselves concerning the knowledge of some scientific writing based on the textbook or international journal that we offer as references. During the class, there will be a temporary discussion in order to evaluate whether the students understand or not.
